alert.note: Alert for Albany; Laramie (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued March 03 at 3:26PM MST until March 03 at 4:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southeastern Albany County in southeastern Wyoming... Central Laramie County in southeastern Wyoming... * Until 400 PM MST. * At 326 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of North Cheyenne to near Pumpkin Vine, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 8 and 27. Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 335 and 361. Locations impacted include... Cheyenne, Granite Springs Reservoir, Ranchettes, Warren AFB, Frontier Park, Crystal Lake Reservoir, North Cheyenne, Warren Af Base, Crystal Lake Campground, Buford and Granite Springs Campground. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
